title: Complicated Cars Put A Dent In An Old Father-Son Ritual
teaser: The automobile has long served as a symbol of manhood, with lessons in fixing cars doubling as rites of passage for some boys. But that's changing, now that cars are getting more complex and less important in the lives of many young people.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
